column4: ok, serious issues... I did an ubuntu system update and now my system is fucked
I can still boot in to windows, but Ubuntu is giving me error messages
how far does the boot process get?
depends on which kernel I select
if you select the previous kernel does it boot all the way?
atually no, that's what's so concerning, it dumps me to the (initramfs) prompt
are you running stock ubuntu or are you running one that requires a different kernel such as ubuntu studio or perhaps running xen vm?
stock
I run Ardour and stuff but I don't have linux-rt
I don't bother with installing "Studio" or "K-Ubuntu" I just install vanilla Ubuntu and then install other packages if I want them
is there any way you can access /etc/fstab ?
i doubt it
can you access /etc/fstab ?
ok well my previous nix still boots... I've been running 10.10 for a month or two now
so I'm in 10.04 and I have access to the 10.10 partition, so how should I go about diagnosing this?
are you using ext4?
hrm, not absolutely sure
actually don't think so, but it's possible... I'm using whatever the default was for 10.10
i'd back up your files onto the 10.04 and reinstall.  something horrible has happened on that system
the time it would take to recover it will be much longer than backing up and reinstalling
tripple sunnuva... either amount of time is time I don't have :(
